main.name: Jahaira Marrero
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: Passionate about creating innovative solutions with experience building full stack applications with Ruby, Rails, JavaScript, React, SQL databases, and RESTful API architecture. Emerging from a career in Education, I traded the classroom and school leadership for coding when working with software engineers to improve software usability and create better communication lines to families. Fully immersed in coding, I am excited to own  the technical planning, implementation and delivering impactful features as a developer.

education.description: Describe your experience at school, what you learned, what useful skills you have acquired etc.

work.title: Dean of Students
work.description: Collaborated with the School Leaders to create a school culture scope and sequence that utilizes advisory to model, taught, and rewarded students for character development. Facilitated school culture professional development for all staff including practice and feedback sessions on the schoolâ€™s discipline system. Observed classes and teachers to give feedback on classroom culture and the implementation of the schoolwide discipline system. Conducted weekly coaching to include goal setting with staff around improving school culture. Provided clear, consistent consequences to mid-level and high-level student behaviors. Responded directly to high-level student behaviors and supported teachers in responding to low-level behaviors. Established and communicated clear objectives for all learning activities. Identified and selected different instructional resources and methods to meet students' varying needs.

work.title: Math Teacher, Grade Level Chair
work.description: Designed lesson plans and presentations for Math classes designed to remediate and accelerate curriculum for elementary students. education, special education, and Honors students Keep updated with developments in the subject area, teaching resources and methods, and make relevant changes to instructional plans and activities. Maintain discipline in accordance with the rules and disciplinary systems of the school.

work.company: New York City Department of Education
work.title: Biology, Forensic Science Teacher, Grade Level Chair
work.description: Delivered Biology instruction while regulating excellent classroom management skills to maximize student learning. Integrated multiple teaching styles to intensify the range of learning, while redesigning a curriculum aligned with the New York City Biology scope and sequence. Implemented curriculum utilizing project-based education and alternative assessments, integrated a Scientific Literacy Curriculum aligned to the Common Core Standards.

work.title: Administrative Assistant
work.description: Served as the first point of contact for guests, answered phones, and maintained files. Developed, implemented, directed, and managed projects and administrative operations; established priorities and meeting deadlines for a full range of activities to include short and long-range planning, budget forecasting tracking, and reporting.

work.title: Curriculum Coordinator
work.description: Integrated cross coverage for the faculty with the delivery of lectures, small groups, labs and coordinated specific needs accordingly. Spear headed accurate student grades by compiling scored exams and standardizing, modified test scoring through quantitative reports. Prioritized the completion of student evaluations by faculty for score reports.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
